sense.name: an emotional yell or utterance
sense.examples: John gave a sharp cry when the frying pan fell on his foot. There was a cry of 'silence!' from the back of the room. The survivors in the life rafts could hear the cries of the drowning people. The patient's threats of suicide were actually a cry for help. (Metaphoric extension)

sense.name: a rallying slogan
sense.examples: 'No New Taxes' was the candidate's rallying cry during the campaign. 'Yes we can!' is our team's new battle cry.

sense.name: weeping, sobbing
sense.examples: John said he had a good cry over Mary but now he's over her. The lady faked a cry in front of the policeman in hopes he wouldn't give her a ticket. Sally heard the cry of her newborn baby.

sense.name: characteristic call of an animal
sense.examples: Along the dock we heard the cries of seagulls wheeling overhead. The cries of some nocturnal animal could be heard from our campsite.

sense.name: hawking of a street vendor
sense.examples: The marketplace was filled with cries of vendors selling fresh fish and produce.

sense.name: urgent request, made collectively
sense.examples: Their government has issued a cry of help to several relief organizations. Only one vessel responded to the disabled ship's cry for assistance.

sense.name: public demand, made collectively
sense.examples: The governor is trying to address the public's cry for relief from high heating costs this winter. There were cries for his resignation after the scandal.
